{{Marvel Database:Organization Template | Image = New U Technologies (Earth-616) from Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 19 001.jpg | Name = New U Technologies | Aliases = New U, Team Jackal{{r|Clone Conspiracy Vol 1 4}} | Leaders = Formerly [[Benjamin Reilly (Earth-616)|Jackal]] | CurrentMembers = | FormerMembers = [[Oksana Sytsevich (Earth-616)|Oksana Sytsevich]], [[Aleksei Sytsevich (Earth-616)|Rhino]],

[[Sally Avril (Earth-616)|Sally Avril]] | Identity = Public | Affiliation = | Allies = Formerly [[John Jonah Jameson (Earth-616)|J. Jonah Jameson]] | Enemies = Formerly [[Fisk Industries (Earth-616)|Fisk Enterprises]], [[Parker Industries (Earth-616)|Parker Industries]] | Origin = | Reality = Earth-616 | Status = Defunct | BaseOfOperations = Formerly [[Transamerica Pyramid]] / [[New U Headquarters]], [[San Francisco]], [[California (State)|California]] | PlaceOfFormation = [[San Francisco]], [[California (State)|California]] | PlaceOfDissolution = [[Transamerica Pyramid]], [[San Francisco]], [[California (State)|California]] | Creators = Dan Slott; Giuseppe Camuncoli | First = Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 2 | History = ===Overview=== New U Technologies was an [[United States of America|American]] biotech company located in [[San Francisco]], [[California (State)|California]], which was founded and run by [[Benjamin Reilly (Earth-616)|The Jackal]]. Through New U, the Jackal developed a revolutionary procedure which involved cloning tissue free of disease, and would eventually offer it as a cutting-edge medical treatment fronted by [[Rita Clarkson (Earth-616)|Dr. Rita Clarkson]].{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 16}} ===Before Dead No More=== Using the resources at his disposal, the Jackal had started to reanimate the dead in cloned bodies, with the intention of using them to manipulate their loved ones to do his bidding, beginning with [[George Stacy (Earth-616)|George]] and [[Gwendolyne Stacy (Earth-616)|Gwen Stacy]].{{r|Clone Conspiracy Vol 1 1}} He then secured the services of the [[Aleksei Sytsevich (Earth-616)|Rhino]] by reanimating [[Oksana Sytsevich (Earth-616)|Oksana Sytsevich]],{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 2}} as well as those of the [[Curtis Connors (Earth-616)|Lizard]] with the return of [[William Connors (Earth-616)|Billy]] and [[Martha Connors (Earth-616)|Martha Connors]],{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 4}} whom they broke out of the [[Andru Correctional Facility]] alongside [[Maxwell Dillon (Earth-616)|Max Dillon]].{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 10}} The Jackal next attempted to bring [[Fisk Industries (Earth-616)|Fisk Enterprises]] into the fold; however, the [[Wilson Fisk (Earth-616)|Kingpin]] saw the reanimated [[Vanessa Fisk (Earth-616)|Vanessa Fisk]] as an abomination, swiftly killing her and ordering [[Kingpin's Henchmen|his men]] to shoot the Jackal for the pain he'd caused.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 19}} This forced the Rhino to have to intervene and drew the attention of [[Peter Parker (Earth-616)|Spider-Man]].{{r|Free Comic Book Day Vol 2016 (Captain America)}} When [[John Jonah Jameson, Sr. (Earth-616)|Jay Jameson]] fell ill,{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 15}} the attending physician, [[Character Index/M#McCray|Dr. McCray]], contacted Dr. Clarkson. Peter Parker was initially skeptical and decided to fly to [[San Francisco]] to meet with New U Technologies to discuss the procedure further.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 16}} En route, he contacted [[Hobie Brown (Earth-616)|Prowler]] and asked him to break into [[New U Headquarters]],{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 17}} where unbeknownst to them the Jackal, Lizard, and Dr. Martha Connors were preparing to restore Max Dillon's powers, producing [[Francine Frye (Earth-616)|Francine Frye]], back from the dead, to further persuade him.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 16}} The procedure failed; however, Francine could feel the electrical power because the DNA harvested to produce her reanimation was tainted by the kiss from Max that originally cost her her life. She kissed Max once again, the powers of Electro flowing into her, electrocuting Max in the process. Prowler revealed himself and attempted to intervene, but was too late to save Max's life. Hobie then tried to flee, but Francine, overzealous for her first fight, apparently killed him too, forcing the Jackal to "reanimate" [[Hobie Brown (Clone) (Earth-616)|Prowler]] as well.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 17}} Meanwhile, an industrial accident at a [[Parker Industries (Earth-616)|Parker Industries]] facility in [[Oklahoma (State)|Oklahoma]] catastrophically injured [[Jerome Salteres (Earth-616)|Jerry Salteres]]. With two people in his life now gravely ill, Peter then decided to bring in Dr. Clarkson to save the life of his employee as an extreme test case, which the Jackal approved of, despite it not being part of their plan.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 16}} Peter once again contacted Prowler, unaware that he had been reanimated, and Hobie told him that he had uncovered nothing of concern;{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 17}} however, after the procedure, Peter went to visit Jerry in the hospital, only to discover that the man now set off his Spider-Sense. Back in [[California (State)|California]], Dr. Clarkson met with Jay's son, [[John Jonah Jameson (Earth-616)|J. Jonah Jameson]], and to prove there was no limits to what New U could do, introduced him to his reanimated wife, [[Marla Madison (Earth-616)|Dr. Marla Madison-Jameson]],{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 16}} who prompted her husband to use his position at [[Fact Channel News (Earth-616)|Fact Channel News]] to promote New U Technologies and attempt to pressure Peter, who remained hesitant due to the earlier triggering of his Spider-Sense, into convincing [[Maybelle Parker (Earth-616)|May Parker-Jameson]] that their procedure would be best for his father; however, Jay passed away in the interim.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 19}} With the knowledge he acquired from the New U files that Peter sent to [[Anna Maria Marconi (Earth-616)|Anna Maria Marconi]] investigate,{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 16}} the copy of [[Otto Octavius (Earth-616)|Doctor Octopus]]' consciousness, who had secretly worked for months at Parker Industries as the [[Living Brain (Earth-616)|Living Brain]], decided to clone his former self's body in order to inhabit it.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 18}} It led Otto to discover that New U Technologies had been buying the bodies of many deceased criminals, such as his former self and the [[Alistaire Smythe (Earth-616)|Spider-Slayer]], in order to bring them back to life through cloning. Otto secretly had his former self's body delivered to New U Headquarters, where it was cloned and cleansed of any disease. After erasing [[Peter Parker (New U Duplicate) (Earth-616)|the copy of Peter Parker's consciousness]] from the cloned body's brain and taking over it, Otto was invited by the Jackal to be part of New U Technologies.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 20}} ===Dead No More=== After attending Jay's funeral, Peter and Anna Maria paid Jerry Salteres a visit in order to investigate New U Technologies further, and ended up discovering that he had been taken by New U for suffering from what Peter identified as cellular degeneration for not taking the [[New U Pills]] daily as prescribed. Using a microscopic [[Spider-Tracer]] he had tagged Jerry with at the hospital when his Spider-Sense had gone off, Peter Parker infiltrated New U Headquarters as Spider-Man, and eventually found Jerry's nervous system, completely stripped off his body but still alive, inside a stasis tube. Peter was eventually confronted by the Jackal,{{r|Clone Conspiracy Vol 1 1}} along with all of villains who had been resurrected by him, Gwen and Captain Stacy. Ben offered Peter a chance to join him, in order to use the combined power of New U and Parker Industries to help the world, but Peter turned him down. When Gwen Stacy was outed as an impostor, with the original having being replaced by [[Gwendolyn Stacy (Earth-65)|her superpowered counterpart]] from [[Earth-65|an alternate universe]] who had been investigating the Jackal's operations, Peter found the chance to escape with her.{{r|Clone Conspiracy Vol 1 2}} Eluding capture from other villains, Ben caught up with Peter, who overpowered him easily. Finally, Ben unmasked and revealed his identity to Peter. He made his offer again to Peter, this time offering up the chance to bring back [[Benjamin Parker (Earth-616)|Uncle Ben]] as an incentive.{{r|Clone Conspiracy Vol 1 3}} After hearing Ben's story of his resurrection,{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 4 22}} Peter accompanied him to his secondary base of operations, [[Transamerica Pyramid]], seemingly giving Ben a chance. [[File:Ben Reilly (Earth-616) from Clone Conspiracy Vol 1 3 001.png|thumb|left|Ben reveals himself to Peter]] Once there, Ben showed Peter the apparent utopia he had built, a place where Spider-Man's friends and foes coexisted peacefully. Having realized that Ben possessed power but not responsibility, Peter reprimanded him, prompting Ben to order the villains he had brought back to attack him. Reilly returned to the lab, where Doc Ock and Ben's hostage [[Anna Maria Marconi (Earth-616)|Anna Maria Marconi]] had discovered it was a specific type of frequency which caused the cellular decay, and an inverse frequency could stop the decay altogether. Doc Ock amplified the frequency responsible for the decay and piped it throughout the base after discovering that the Jackal was a clone, having decided to sabotage his enterprise for having disrespected Anna Maria, whom Otto loved. When all the clones in the base began to break down and turn into [[Carrion]]s, Ben decided to broadcast the decaying signal across the entire world, causing an outbreak of the [[Carrion Virus]] globally, with the intention to bring every single person back as a clone once they had died.{{r|Clone Conspiracy Vol 1 4}} Spider-Man managed to hack into the emergency system of his [[Webware]] and had all of these devices globally emit the inverse frequency, stopping the outbreak and curing all those who hadn't yet completely broken down. With his plan having collapsed, the Jackal took the opportunity to fake his death, having survived his decay but putting his clothes on top of a pile of a clone's ashes. Having seen the error of her ways, Rita Clarkson revealed to Spider-Man a sub-basement where New U's patients were kept in stasis while their respective clones took over their lives. Some of these patients were going to die due to the illness that New U was supposed to cure, while others managed to survive due to New U's procedures having restored them to a healthy state.{{r|Clone Conspiracy Vol 1 5}} Clarkson also gave S.H.I.E.L.D. access to the database of New U's clients worldwide. Transamerica Pyramid was then taken over by S.H.I.E.L.D. to calculate any possible bio-hazard risk and dismantle the remains of the Jackal's enterprise.{{r|Clone Conspiracy Omega Vol 1 1}} | Equipment = [[New U Pills]] | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = | Trivia = | Links = }} [[Category:Companies]]
